title: 105_hr4657
content: The Act titled "Spring Mountain Exchange Act of 1998" allows for the exchange of lands and mineral interests. The Spring Mountain Exchange Act of 1998 allows the Secretary of the Interior to convey approximately 1,463 acres of Federal lands in Nevada to Rhodes Design and Development Corporation in exchange for lands and interests conveyed by the Corporation. The Secretary of the Interior will determine lands and interests for exchange within 90 days of the Act's enactment. The Corporation must convey approximately 490 acres of lands in Nevada to the United States for the exchange to proceed. The fair market values of lands will be equalized. The Secretary will ensure equalization of fair market values of lands and interests exchanged by payment in accordance with federal land policy. Valuation will be based on nationally recognized appraisal standards and without consideration of threatened or endangered species. The Secretary will require direct payments to the State of Nevada and the Southern Nevada Water Authority from the Corporation as a term of any conveyance under the Endangered Species Act of 1973. The payments will be equal to 5 percent of the fair market value of the Federal lands conveyed and will be compensated by the Secretary. The Corporation will make direct payments to the State of Nevada and the Southern Nevada Water Authority equal to a percentage of the fair market value of Federal lands conveyed. The Authority will use the payment for water treatment and transmission infrastructure in Clark County, Nevada. The Secretary may make minor corrections to maps with agreement from the Corporation. The Corporation can cancel the land exchange before completion, leading to the lands reverting to their original status. Once the United States accepts title to acquired lands, they will be managed according to applicable laws and plans. Under this section, interests acquired by the United States within designated conservation areas become part of the area without further action and are managed according to applicable laws and plans. The term "Corporation" refers to the Rhodes Corporation. The term "Corporation" refers to the Rhodes Design and Development Corporation established in Nevada, while the term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior.
